entry.title: Why are we bleeding nodes?
entry.summary: The email thread discusses the need for simplicity and education in Bitcoin. The email author believes that it is crucially important to make it "mind-numbingly simple" for the average user to run Bitcoin correctly. He thinks that third-party wallets, like Coinbase and Bitstamp, are winning the user experience battle, even though they technically put users at risk. Additionally, there is a call for a business offering Bitcoin wallet insurance, which would provide coverage in case of theft or hacking. The email author believes that this type of service would help to fix the cultural victim-blaming problem that is currently prevalent in the Bitcoin community. There is also a discussion about multi-sig as a default option. The author suggests that multi-sig will not succeed unless the user experience is better than trusted third parties. However, he does suggest that multi-sig could be beneficial if insurance underwriters test and approve it for reducing fraud. Overall, the email thread highlights the need for increased simplicity, education, and security in the Bitcoin community.
